description: Mitchell Starc’s Ashes heroics capped a series that underlined both his durability and evolution. As the left-armer moves closer to the game’s all-time highest wicket-takers, his childhood coach Neil de Costa recalls the defining philosophy that shaped Starc’s career: bowl fast, swing hard and ignore anyone who tells you otherwise.

Tamil Nadu CM Stalin launches distribution of Pongal gift hampers
description: These gift hampers, each comprising one kilogram of raw rice, one kilogram of sugar and one full sugarcane along with ₹3,000 in cash, will be distributed over five days till January 12, 2026

description: The Election Commission of India’s mandate is to ensure no Indian is disenfranchised

title: Silver slides Rs 10k on MCX: March 2026 future prices fall nearly 3%; what's the outlook?
description: Silver prices experienced a significant drop of Rs 10,000 on Thursday, with March 2026 futures plummeting. This sharp correction follows December's record high, signaling market instability. HSBC forecasts a gradual decline in silver prices over the next few years, citing weakening industrial and jewelry demand, despite a projected deficit. Increased mining output also contributes to the bearish outlook.

title: Watch: Protests spread across Iran over high inflation, as calls for more protests grow
description: Hundreds of people took to the streets in several Iranian cities, protesting soaring inflation and the sharp fall in the value of the national currency.

Jana Nayagan: Why is the Thalapathy Vijay starrer postponed?
description: Thalapathy Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' faces an indefinite postponement due to extensive cuts and mutes mandated by the CBFC, alongside ongoing court proceedings. Over 50 politically sensitive dialogues were muted, and violent scenes blacked out, impacting the film's release. Pongal court holidays further stall immediate judicial resolutions, forcing producers to delay the theatrical launch.

title: Rock band Scorpions to tour India with four concerts in April
description: Legendary German hard-rock band Scorpions will tour India in April 2026, with stops at Mumbai, Shillong, Bengaluru and Delhi

Gen Z uprising in Pakistan? PhD student's article challenges those in power — why it was taken down
description: A PhD student's article, "It is over," critically examining Pakistan's ruling establishment and Gen Z's disillusionment, sparked widespread debate. The piece, later removed from publication, argued that young Pakistanis see through imposed patriotism and demand justice and opportunity, signaling a potential shift from quiet discontent to open resistance.

title: US leaves India-headquartered International Solar Alliance after Trump order: What to know

‘America is sick’: As new US dietary guidelines recommend less processed food, more protein, cooking with butter; cardiologist weighs in
Rahila Firdous' journey: Engineering degree, keeping gloves & Dhoni as idol | EXCLUSIVE
description: Bhopal-born cricketer Rahila Firdous, inspired by Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni, has earned an engineering degree while honing her cricket skills. After impressive domestic performances, she was picked by Mumbai Indians for Rs 10 lakh in the WPL auction, a significant career leap. Rahila is eager to learn from skipper Harmanpreet Kaur and leverage the WPL platform for growth.

Confidential data leaked? Japan nuclear regulator loses phone in China
description: Japan's nuclear safety regulator reported a work-issued smartphone containing sensitive contact details of nuclear security personnel was lost by an employee during a personal trip to China. The device, used for disaster communication, did not access facility data but held confidential information, raising security concerns.

Sportsmanship debate: 'Kids look up to him' - Carlsen's outbursts cast shadow over chess
description: Magnus Carlsen's repeated emotional outbursts, including slamming boards and scattering pieces, have sparked debate about sportsmanship in elite chess. While FIDE prioritizes commercial success, critics argue that unaddressed behavior sends the wrong message to young players who idolize the world champion.

title: After ODI squad snub, Ruturaj Gaikwad equals Vijay Hazare Trophy record with 15th century
The quiet unease beneath an AI-led hiring boom: Why 80% of people feel unprepared for work in 2026
description: A new LinkedIn report reveals a 2026 job market marked by uncertainty, with 80% of job seekers feeling unprepared and recruiters struggling to find quality talent.  AI is reshaping hiring, making it more data-driven but less transparent.  This creates a confidence gap, as both sides navigate evolving, algorithm-driven processes where visibility depends on machine-readable signals.

More degrees, fewer jobs: Why India’s educated women are still shut out of the workforce
description: India’s rising female enrolment in higher education masks a deeper economic failure. Despite earning degrees in record numbers, only about one-third of Indian women are considered employable, according to TeamLease data. Sectoral barriers, persistent pay gaps, and weak career pipelines continue to push women out of the workforce, turning educational gains into stalled economic progress.

description: Pakistan's defence minister claims a surge in aircraft orders, potentially ending IMF reliance within six months. This follows a military standoff with India and discussions with Bangladesh and Saudi Arabia for JF-17 fighter jet deals. The Pak minister expressed strong confidence in these orders materializing, suggesting a significant boost to Pakistan's economy.

The court emphasized the dangers posed by stray animals on roads, urging civic bodies to strictly implement rules for their management and removal.

National shooting coach suspended after minor accuses him of sexual harassment
description: India's shooting coach Ankush Bhardwaj has been suspended by the National Rifle Association of India (NRAI) following a sexual harassment accusation by a minor shooter. An FIR has been filed against Bhardwaj, who was recommended by the NRAI for a coaching role post-Paris Olympics. The incident reportedly occurred last month after a training session.

BJP-AIMIM tie-up in Akot collapses hours after CM Fadnavis warning
description: An alliance between BJP and AIMIM in Akola's Akot town collapsed within hours after CM Devendra Fadnavis warned of action. The state BJP issued a show-cause notice to Akot MLA Prakash Bharsakale for promoting the arrangement without party consultation. A new front, 'Akot Nagar Vikas Manch', formed with support from multiple parties, claimed majority.

title: Dhurandhar Box Office Collection Day 34 Worldwide​ Update: Ranveer Singh film struggles to cross Rs 3 cr mark in India; earns Rs 1259.44 cr globally,

Cop alleges assault, MLA pressure over ‘illegal’ mining; suspended for ‘misconduct’
Over a lakh enumerators, 15,000 supervisors: How Odisha is gearing up for Census
Bar association says it will skip stone-laying ceremony of Gauhati High Court complex
Bengal elections 3 months away, a new BJP team in place
UP govt cancels assistant professor recruitment exam after paper leak
description: The Uttar Pradesh government has cancelled the assistant professor recruitment exam. This decision follows serious irregularities and a paper leak. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered the cancellation after an inquiry confirmed the issues. The exam was held last year for over a thousand posts. The government assures a fair and transparent process for the new exam dates.

title: ‘Bramayugam’: Mammootty film enters Oscar Academy space
description: Mammootty's film 'Bramayugam' is set for a prestigious screening at the Academy Museum of Motion Pictures in Los Angeles on February 12, 2026. This marks the first time a Mammootty-starrer will be shown at the museum, as part of the 'Where the Forest Meets the Sea' folk horror series.

title: Missing since December, woman’s skeletal remains found 300 metres from her house in UP
description: A skeleton, believed to be that of a 30-year-old missing woman, was discovered in a mustard field near her home in Nagram. Family members identified a sari found at the scene, leading to suspicions about her husband, who is now under investigation. The remains have been sent for post-mortem to confirm identity and cause of death.

title: Delhi pollution is deadlier than you think: Ask your heart
description: A pilot study in Delhi revealed a direct link between rising air pollution and cardiovascular emergencies, with admissions increasing significantly with spikes in AQI, PM10, and PM2.5. In contrast, Shimla showed no such correlation, highlighting the severe short-term health impacts of pollution in urban areas.

title: Hit by Op Sindoor, panic-stricken Pak mounted frantic lobbying in US
description: Following India's military retaliation against a terror attack, Pakistan urgently sought US mediation to halt New Delhi's strikes.  FARA filings reveal Islamabad's frantic lobbying efforts, involving over 60 contacts with US officials and media.  Pakistan's hired firm, Squire Patton Boggs, aimed to secure American intervention to "somehow halt" India's operations, indicating significant behind-the-scenes panic.

title: Fugitive wife killer living as Punjabi carpenter caught by police 26 years later
description: A carpenter in Ludhiana, living under an assumed identity for 14 years, was apprehended by Delhi Police. He was a fugitive, having escaped parole in 2000 after being sentenced for his wife's murder in 1992.  The police tracked him down through a tip-off, ending his decade-long evasion.

title: Delhi: 3 days after motorist fell off Wazirpur flyover, another critically injured
description: Two men have fallen from the Wazirpur flyover in Delhi within three days, with one fatality and another critically injured. Police suspect an engineering defect due to a one-foot gap between carriageways and inadequate barriers. They are writing to the concerned agency to examine structural flaws and have recommended speed breakers and barriers.

title: Human-elephant conflict spikes in Jharkhand, 22 people dead in 21 days
description: Jharkhand faces a severe human-elephant conflict, with 22 deaths in 21 days. A rogue elephant in West Singhbhum, in musth, has killed 16 since January 1, while another in Ramgarh turned violent after being attacked. Operations are hampered by IEDs. Villagers in vulnerable areas are being relocated.

title: Did Sidda celebrate record of longest-serving CM prematurely?
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's supporters celebrated a 'country chicken feast' for his tenure, though the official record as longest-serving CM is days away. Political analysts questioned the premature fanfare amidst speculation about leadership changes.  Siddaramaiah, however, highlighted his government's achievements and dismissed opposition criticism.

title: Philanthropy push: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife donates billions to non-profits; biggest giveaway in 2025
description: Mackenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon's founder, has significantly reduced her stake in the e-commerce giant, selling shares worth $13 billion.  She continues her massive philanthropic efforts, donating $7.1 billion to non-profits in 2025 alone, including over $1.2 billion to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  These substantial, unrestricted grants are seen as a counterpoint to tech companies scaling back DEI initiatives.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
description: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy ideas, from EVs and solar to massive battery production. He highlighted China's dominance in these sectors, contrasting it with US potential. Musk emphasized batteries, like Tesla's Megapacks, as crucial for doubling US energy throughput without new power plants, especially for AI's growing demands.

title: 'Shameful, embarrassing': After clip shared by student, civic body erases defaced murals on Gwalior wall
description: A viral video of defaced yoga murals in Gwalior, shared by a Class 11 student, sparked outrage. The artwork, part of a Smart City initiative, was marred by vulgar markings. Following public outcry and an influencer's repair attempt, the Municipal Corporation repainted the wall white and plans a Gen Z art event to promote positive messages.
